com.werdpressed.partisan.rundo

Class RunDo

  • java.lang.Object
    • Fragment
      • com.werdpressed.partisan.rundo.RunDo

  • public class RunDo
extends Fragment
    Adds Undo/Redo functions to either an instance of, or a class that inherits from, EditText

    Implementation will often simply be a case of instantiating a RunDo object, passing an EditText argument and calling undo() and redo() methods.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  RunDo.ErrorHandlingCallback
      Implement for custom error handling if IndexOutOfBoundsException encountered when calling undo() or redo().
      static class  RunDo.TrackingState
      Tracks whether the user is currently typing (CURRENT), whether user has finished typing and tracking is ready to restart (ENDED), or whether user has finished typing but tracking is not yet ready to begin (STARTED).
      static interface  RunDo.UndoRedoCallbacks
      Provides callbacks whenever undo() and redo() methods are called.

      void undo()
      Retrieves the following: String containing the last saved section of text Integer array containing first and last points of deviation SubtractStrings.AlterationType enum that specifies whether text was last replaced, added or deleted. An optional message will appear to prompt the user that the Undo queue is empty if the queue is either at max capacity, or the next entry in the queue is null

      If an error occurs, by default a Toast will appear specifying details of the error, and all queues will be cleared.

      • newInstance

        public static RunDo newInstance(int editTextResourceId)
        Returns new RunDo instance with default values for countdown and arraySize
        See Also:
        newInstance(int, int, int)

      • newInstance

        public static RunDo newInstance(int editTextResourceId,
                int countDown,
                int arraySize)
        Returns a new RunDo instance.

        Fragment is used to retain information through configuration changes.
        Parameters:
        editTextResourceId - Optional resource id for an EditText instance. The simplest way to achieve this is to use the getId() method.

        It is possible to pass 0, and provide an EditText instance with setEditText(Object).
        countDown - Optional countdown in milliseconds. This defines the period of time between when a user stops typing, and a Runnable is called to being saving data to the undo array.

        A value of less than 1 will result in the default 2000 millisecond countdown.
        arraySize - Optional value that specifies the size of the Undo and Redo array queues.

        An argument with a value of less than 1 will use the default value of 10.
        Returns:
        New RunDo instance, with arguments.

      • undo

        public void undo()
        Retrieves the following:
        • String containing the last saved section of text
        • Integer array containing first and last points of deviation
        • SubtractStrings.AlterationType enum that specifies whether text was last replaced, added or deleted.
        An optional message will appear to prompt the user that the Undo queue is empty if the queue is either at max capacity, or the next entry in the queue is null

        If an error occurs, by default a Toast will appear specifying details of the error, and all queues will be cleared.

      • redo

        public void redo()
        Works in parallel with undo(). Retrieves the following:
        • String containing the last saved section of text
        • Integer array containing first and last points of deviation
        • SubtractStrings.AlterationType enum that specifies whether text was last replaced, added or deleted.
        An optional message will appear to prompt the user that the Undo queue is empty if the queue is either at max capacity, or the next entry in the queue is null

        If an error occurs, by default a Toast will appear specifying details of the error, and all queues will be cleared.

      • setAutoErrorHandling

        public void setAutoErrorHandling(boolean autoErrorHandling)
        Determines whether default error handling is enabled. When true, any undo() or redo() call that results in an IndexOutOfBoundsException will:

        • Send a Toast notification with error toString() message
        • Send output to LogCat
        • Call clearAllArrayDequeue()


        Custom handling can be set using RunDo.ErrorHandlingCallback
        Parameters:
        autoErrorHandling - true to enable default behaviour, false to disable.
        See Also:
        RunDo.ErrorHandlingCallback}

      • getAutoErrorHandling

        public boolean getAutoErrorHandling()
        Returns whether default error handling for IndexOutOfBoundsExceptions in undo() and redo() are enabled.
        Returns:
        true if default behaviour active.

      • clearAllQueues

        public void clearAllQueues()
        Clears all Undo and Redo queues

      • setEditText

        public void setEditText(java.lang.Object object)
        Provide an Object that either extends, or is an instance of, EditText.

        This is essential for all method calls to avoid a NullPointerException
        Parameters:
        object - Argument must be of a Class that either inherits from, or is a direct instance of, EditText.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException

      • getEditText

        public java.lang.Object getEditText()
        Retrieve the EditText associated with this Class instance.
        Returns:
        Object that either inherits from, or is a direct instance of, EditText

      • setKeyboardShortcuts

        public void setKeyboardShortcuts(boolean shortcutsActive)
        Enables common shortcuts for hardware keyboards. Ctrl + Z will call undo(), whilst Ctrl + Y will call redo().
        Parameters:
        shortcutsActive - Pass true to enable keyboard shortcuts.
        See Also:
        areKeyboardShortcutsActive()

      • areKeyboardShortcutsActive

        public boolean areKeyboardShortcutsActive()
        Returns:
        Returns true if common hardware keyboard shortcuts are currently active.
        See Also:
        setKeyboardShortcuts(boolean)

      • getEditTextResourceId

        public int getEditTextResourceId()
        Retrieve the resource id for the EditText associated with this Class instance.
        Returns:
        Resource id for EditText, as int value.

      • getCountdownSize

        public int getCountdownSize()
        Retrieve time in milliseconds between user finishing typing and a Runnable launching the Undo save process
        Returns:
        Time in milliseconds, as int value;

      • getUndoRedoArraySize

        public int getUndoRedoArraySize()
        Size of the Undo and Redo arrays. This value determines the maximum amount of Undo queue storage before items are deleted.
        Returns:
        Size of Undo/Redo queue, as int value;

      • isAutoSave

        public boolean isAutoSave()
        Specifies whether AutoSave feature is currently active. When this returns false, no further data will be saved to the Undo queue. This value is true by default.
        Returns:
        true if AutoSave is currently active, otherwise false

      • setAutoSaveSwitch

        public void setAutoSaveSwitch(boolean autoSaveSwitch)
        Set to true to activate AutoSave. When AutoSave is inactive, no data will be saved to the Undo queue.
        Parameters:
        autoSaveSwitch - true to enabled the AutoSave feature, otherwise false

      • setUndoQueueEmptyMessage

        public void setUndoQueueEmptyMessage(boolean condition,
                            java.lang.String message)
        Specify whether a Toast will appear when undo() is called, but the Undo queue is either empty or the next item is null, and whether a custom message will appear instead of the default.
        Parameters:
        condition - true will send a Toast message if undo() is called when Undo queue is empty, or next value is null.
        message - Optional message to send in the Toast notification. Passing null here will use the default value.
        See Also:
        setRedoQueueEmptyMessage(boolean, String)

      • setRedoQueueEmptyMessage

        public void setRedoQueueEmptyMessage(boolean condition,
                            java.lang.String message)
        Specify whether a Toast will appear when redo() is called, but the Redo queue is either empty or the next item is null, and whether a custom message will appear instead of the default.
        Parameters:
        condition - true will send a Toast message if redo() is called when Redo queue is empty, or next value is null.
        message - Optional message to send in the Toast notification. Passing null here will use the default value.
        See Also:
        setUndoQueueEmptyMessage(boolean, String)
